perturbation.original_text: Each Party will indemnify the Company and hold it harmless for, from and against any claims, demands, costs or expenses arising out of or relating to such consolidated financial statements, provided that such indemnity shall not apply to claims, demands, costs or expenses to the extent they are related to the Company's financial statements provided to such Party.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party will indemnify the Company and hold it harmless for, from and against any claims, demands, costs or expenses arising out of or relating to such consolidated financial statements.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of 'provided that such indemnity shall not apply to claims, demands, costs or expenses to the extent they are related to the Company's financial statements provided to such Party' eliminates an important exception, thereby making each party potentially liable for errors in the Company's own financial statements. This creates a legal risk because under general principles of corporate law, parties are not usually indemnified for damages that arise from their own negligence or misconduct. This contradicts standard indemnity principles.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of corporate law and indemnity; common law regarding negligence.

perturbation.explanation: The deletion of clause (v) which allows for termination of the agreement if there's a change of control where the acquiring entity is objectionable to the US or Japanese government removes an important safeguard. Without this clause, TPH/TPH-A or FSL/AFSL could be forced to continue a joint venture with an entity that poses national security concerns, or is otherwise inappropriate under governmental regulations related to international trade or foreign investment.
perturbation.contradicted_law: National security regulations, foreign investment laws (e.g., CFIUS in the US, similar regulations in Japan)

perturbation.original_text: 11.19 Counsel only to TPH and TPH-A. Wilson Sonsini Goodrich & Rosati, P.C. ("WSGR") and Mori Hamada & Matsumoto ("MHM") are counsel solely to TPH-A and TPH. The other Parties to the Agreement acknowledge that they are not relying on WSGR or MHM for advice in connection with the matters related to this Agreement and the transactions contemplated hereby, and that they have had the opportunity consult counsel of their own choosing and have elected not to do so.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.19 Counsel only to TPH and TPH-A. Wilson Sonsini Goodrich & Rosati, P.C. ("WSGR") and Mori Hamada & Matsumoto ("MHM") are counsel solely to TPH-A and TPH. The other Parties to the Agreement acknowledge that they are not relying on WSGR or MHM for advice in connection with the matters related to this Agreement and the transactions contemplated hereby.
perturbation.explanation: The deletion of the phrase 'and that they have had the opportunity consult counsel of their own choosing and have elected not to do so' introduces ambiguity and potential legal risk. By removing acknowledgement that the other parties *could* consult their own counsel, creates an impression the other party may be at a disadvantage by not having their own counsel. This creates legal risk as, in later disputes, the other parties can plausibly argue they didn't fully understand the risks due to not having their own representation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles of fairness and informed consent in contract law; potential claims of unequal bargaining power.
